title: How to Install LED Lighting in Your House

steps.headline: Pick your location.
steps.description: The very first step of installing LED lighting is to decide where you want to put them. Many people prefer to place such lighting under kitchen cabinets, but you can think of more unusual places such as behind paintings for example.

steps.headline: Mark your placement.
steps.description: Now you have to mark the whole placement for your LED lighting so that you know exactly where the wiring will have to be.

steps.headline: Find somewhere to put the electrical source for your LED lighting.
steps.description: Ideally, this will be hidden somewhere like in a kitchen cabinet.

steps.headline: Drill as many holes as you need to get the wiring through (assuming you have decided to put the power source in the kitchen cabinet).
Find a circuit that you are going to use for the LED lights.
Get the electrical wire from your circuit box and feed it to the place where your power source is.
Connect the LED lighting to the wire from your lighting source.
steps.description: Make sure to connect the wiring correctly in order to avoid various issues with your lighting.

steps.headline: Connect the ground wires from the LED lights power source to the switch box.
Turn on the circuit and test your new LED lighting.
steps.description: Everything should work fine if you have connected the wires properly.

text: Pick your location. The very first step of installing LED lighting is to decide where you want to put them. Many people prefer to place such lighting under kitchen cabinets, but you can think of more unusual places such as behind paintings for example. Mark your placement. Now you have to mark the whole placement for your LED lighting so that you know exactly where the wiring will have to be. Find somewhere to put the electrical source for your LED lighting. Ideally, this will be hidden somewhere like in a kitchen cabinet. Drill as many holes as you need to get the wiring through (assuming you have decided to put the power source in the kitchen cabinet).  Find a circuit that you are going to use for the LED lights.  Turn that circuit off.  Get the electrical wire from your circuit box and feed it to the place where your power source is.  Connect the LED lighting to the wire from your lighting source. Make sure to connect the wiring correctly in order to avoid various issues with your lighting. Connect the ground wires from the LED lights power source to the switch box.  Turn on the circuit and test your new LED lighting. Everything should work fine if you have connected the wires properly.
